Test Steps:
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Enter Name: John Doe
3. Enter Email: john@example.com
4. Enter Password: SecurePass123
5. Click Register button
Pre-condition: User is not logged in, email is unique
Post-condition: User is registered in database, session is not started yet
Expected Result: Success message: Registration successful displayed, user can login

Test Steps:
1. Register first user with email: test@example.com
2. Attempt to register second user with same email
3. Submit form
Post-condition: Registration attempt fails, user not added to database
Expected Result: Error message: Email already registered displayed

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Leave Name field empty
3. Enter Email: user@example.com
4. Enter Password: Pass123
5. Submit form
Post-condition: Form validation occurs, no database insert
Expected Result: Form validation error for required Name field

Test Case Description: Login with Correct Email and Password
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter Email: john@example.com
3. Enter Password: SecurePass123
4. Click Login button
Pre-condition: User is registered with email john@example.com, password hash stored
Post-condition: Session user_id is set, user is redirected
Expected Result: User redirected to dashboard, $_SESSION['user_id'] is set

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter Email: nonexistent@example.com
3. Enter Password: AnyPassword123
4. Click Login button
Pre-condition: Email does not exist in database
Post-condition: Login fails, session not created
Expected Result: Error message: Invalid email or password displayed

Test Case Description: Login with Correct Email but Wrong Password
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter Email: john@example.com
3. Enter Password: WrongPassword456
4. Click Login button
Pre-condition: User is registered with email john@example.com
Post-condition: Login fails, session not created
Expected Result: Error message: Invalid email or password displayed

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Leave Email field empty
3. Enter Password: SecurePass123
4. Click Login button
Post-condition: Login validation fails, no database query
Expected Result: Form validation error for Email field

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter Email: john@example.com
3. Leave Password field empty
4. Click Login button
Post-condition: Login validation fails, no database query
Expected Result: Form validation error for Password field

Test Case Description: Login Page Redirect for Authenticated User
Test Steps:
1. User is logged in with active session
2. Navigate to login.php
Post-condition: User is redirected to dashboard
Expected Result: Redirect to dashboard.php occurs, login page not shown

Test Steps:
1. User is logged in
2. Click Logout button
3. Navigate to protected page
Pre-condition: User has active session with user_id
Post-condition: Session is destroyed
Expected Result: Session cleared, redirect to login.php, protected pages not accessible

Test Description: Send Chat Message with Valid Data
Test Steps:
1. Login as requester user
2. Navigate to chat page with accepted request
3. Enter message: Hello instructor
4. Click Send button
Pre-condition: User logged in, request status is accepted, access verified
Post-condition: Message inserted in database, is_read=0
Expected Result: Message sent successfully and appears in chat window

Test Steps:
1. Login as user
2. Navigate to chat page
3. Leave message field empty
4. Click Send button
Pre-condition: User logged in, request is accepted
Post-condition: Empty message is not inserted, no database change
Expected Result: Empty message rejected, no database insert occurs

Test Steps:
1. Login as user_id=10 (not involved in request)
2. Attempt to access chat for request_id=5 (belongs to user_id=1 and 2)
3. Verify access
Pre-condition: User_id=10 is not requester or skill owner of request_id=5
Post-condition: Access check fails, die() executes
Expected Result: Access denied message displayed, page not rendered

Test Steps:
1. Login as skill_owner user_id=1
2. Requester user_id=2 sends message
3. Skill owner accesses chat page
4. Verify message is_read status
Pre-condition: Message from user_id=2 exists with is_read=0 for request involving user_id=1
Post-condition: UPDATE query executes, is_read=1 for incoming messages
Expected Result: Incoming messages marked as read, Unread badge removed

Test Steps:
1. Login and navigate to chat
2. Send 3 messages with timestamps
3. Verify display order
Pre-condition: Request has 3 messages with different timestamps

Test Case Description: Unread Badge Shows for New Messages
Test Steps:
1. Login as recipient
2. Other user sends message (is_read=0)
3. Navigate to chat, verify badge presence
Pre-condition: Message in database with is_read=0 from different sender
Post-condition: Badge rendered in message display
Expected Result: Unread badge (yellow) displays for unread messages

Test Description: Send Skill Request with Valid Data
Test Steps:
1. Login as requester user
2. Navigate to skills list
3. Click Request on a skill (skill_id=3)
4. Verify redirect
Pre-condition: User is logged in, skill_id=3 exists
Post-condition: INSERT query executes, request created with status=pending
Expected Result: Request created in database, user redirected to skills list

Test Steps:
1. User is NOT logged in
2. Attempt to send request via GET: ?skill_id=3
3. Verify redirect
Post-condition: Redirect before database operation
Expected Result: User redirected to login.php

Test Steps:
1. Login as user_id=10
2. Attempt to view request_id=5 (belongs to user_id=1,2)
3. Verify access check
Pre-condition: Request_id=5 has requester_id=1, skill belongs to user_id=2
Post-condition: Access check query returns 0 rows, die() executes
Expected Result: Access denied message, page does not load

Test Steps:
1. Login as user_id=5 (requester of request_id=7)
2. Navigate to request chat
3. Verify access granted and request data loads
Post-condition: Access check returns 1+ rows, request data fetched
Expected Result: Request data loads, chat displayed for requester

Test Steps:
1. Login as user_id=3 (owns skill in request_id=7)
2. Navigate to request chat
3. Verify access granted
Pre-condition: Request_id=7 involves skill owned by user_id=3, status=accepted
Post-condition: Access check returns 1+ rows, request data fetched
Expected Result: Request data loads, chat displayed for skill owner

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter Email: admin@example.com' OR '1'='1
3. Enter valid Password
4. Click Login
Pre-condition: Database has user admin@example.com with secure password
Post-condition: SQL injection attempt is handled, no authentication bypass
Expected Result: Login fails with invalid credentials, no database compromise

Test Case Description: SQL Injection Prevention in Chat Messages
Test Steps:
1. Login and navigate to chat
2. Send message: ',(0), DROP TABLE users--
3. Verify database integrity
Post-condition: (0) DROP TABLE users--
Expected Result: Message stored with special chars escaped in database

Test Case Description: XSS Script Prevention in Message Display
Test Steps:
1. Login and navigate to chat
2. Send message: <script>alert('XSS')</script>
3. View message in browser
Post-condition: htmlspecialchars() applied to message output
Expected Result: Script tags displayed as text, no execution, safe display

Test Description: XSS Prevention in User Name Display
Test Steps: 1. User registers with name: 2. Login 3. Navigate to chat 4. Verify name display safe
Post-condition: htmlspecialchars() applied to username output
Expected Result: Malicious HTML displayed as text, no execution

Test Steps:
1. Login as user
2. Send request with $_SESSION['user_id'] set
3. Verify session remains active across requests
Post-condition: Session timeout not reached, session active
Expected Result: Session variable accessible, user remains authenticated

Test Steps:
1. Do not login (no session)
2. Attempt to access chat.php directly
3. Verify redirect
Post-condition: session_start() executes, redirect logic checks auth
Expected Result: Redirect to login.php, chat page not accessible

Test Steps:
1. Stop database server
2. Attempt to login
3. Verify error message
Post-condition: invalid port
Expected Result: mysqli_connect() fails, error message displays

Test Steps:
1. Execute malformed SQL (syntax error)
2. Verify error handling
Post-condition: Query fails, mysqli_query returns false
Expected Result: Error captured, no page crash, graceful error handling

Test Steps:

2. Enter Name: John
3. Enter Password: Pass123
4. Submit form

Test Steps:

2. Verify stored value

Test Steps:

2. Login with: john@example.com
3. Verify login success

Expected Result: Login successful if database email case-insensitive

Test Steps:
1. Login user_id=1
2. Send 5 messages rapidly
3. Verify all messages in database
Post-condition: All 5 INSERT queries execute, all messages stored
Expected Result: All 5 messages appear in chat window in order

Test Steps:

2. Send message with 5000 characters
3. Verify storage and display
Post-condition: INSERT succeeds, message stored fully
Expected Result: Large message stored and displayed without truncation

Test Steps:
1. Create pending request (status=pending)
2. Login as requester
3. Attempt to access chat
4. Verify access denied
Post-condition: Access check WHERE requests.status='accepted' fails
Expected Result: Access denied for pending requests

Test Steps:
1. Send chat message with database constraint violation
2. Verify message not stored
Post-condition: INSERT fails due to foreign key, no partial data
Expected Result: Message not stored, database in consistent state

Test Steps:

2. Query database directly
3. Verify password is hashed, not plaintext
Post-condition: password_hash() applied with PASSWORD_DEFAULT
Expected Result: Password stored as bcrypt hash, not plaintext
